page.title: 07Abbotsley Pig Farm
page.content: The Pig farm has about 1000 pigs,2 cows,1 calf,about 200 chickens,15 bullocks and 100 acres of arable and grassland.They take 35 pigs to market every Thursday.They go to St.Neots market because it is the nearest.They take them in a lorry.The market has been in business since 1857,but it is closing down this year.The farmer is worried because there are no more markets in the area.The 200 chickens lay about 700 eggs a week.The cows graze in a field on the farm and produce a lot of milk for the calves and the kitchen but the bullocks graze away from the farm.The farmer is building new pig sties as they are expanding.The farmer takes the manure to the barley field. They grind the barley into pig food.
